alert.note: Alert for Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 21 at 3:31AM CDT until March 23 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TUESDAY TO 1 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 11 inches with locally higher amounts to 15 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Cook County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Grand Portage Reservation. * WHEN...From 1 AM Tuesday to 1 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow should be heavy and wet in nature and may cause power outages and down trees. Ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch are possible near the Tofte area.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
